description: SCHUYLER COUNTY, N.Y. What started as a beautiful sunny day on Seneca Lake in New York turned into a dramatic rescue for Mike Close and his brother Benjamin Tuesday. The two were sitting on the dock at Frog Hollow Marina in Watkins Glen when Mike said to his brother, "Let's go fill up our bait tanks with fresh water." The two were preparing for Seneca Lake's National...
text:
SCHUYLER COUNTY, N.Y. (WETM-TV)  What started as a beautiful sunny day on
Seneca Lake in New York turned into a dramatic rescue for Mike Close and his
brother Benjamin Tuesday.

The two were sitting on the dock at Frog Hollow Marina in Watkins Glen when
Mike said to his brother, "Let's go fill up our bait tanks with fresh water."
The two were preparing for Seneca Lake's National Trout Derby this upcoming
Memorial Day weekend.

The brothers took Benjamin's boat out, they sailed around Painted Rock when
the two saw something weird a mile out. Mike grabbed a pair of binoculars and
saw a capsized kayak, he could see the man waving a paddle.

The two picked up speed, yelling to the man to stay calm and above the water.

"The guy was cold as ice," Mike said. "He was just going down."

When the boat got near the man, Mike tossed him a life preserver and the two
pulled the man to the boat safely.WARNING: The following video may be
disturing to some. Viewer discretion is advised

They raced to shore and called 911. The man was taken away, and Mike, who is
also a five-time heart-attack survivor, went to the local hospital as well for
observation.

The next day, the man who the two brothers saved stopped by Mike's hospital
room to say thank you. "He was amazed that we were brothers," Mike said.

Mike told him, "well, we're your brothers now."

title: Dramatic video shows brothers rescuing man on lake
html:
SCHUYLER COUNTY, N.Y. (WETM-TV) – What started as a beautiful sunny day on Seneca Lake in New York turned into a dramatic rescue for Mike Close and his brother Benjamin Tuesday.

The two were sitting on the dock at Frog Hollow Marina in Watkins Glen when Mike said to his brother, "Let's go fill up our bait tanks with fresh water." The two were preparing for Seneca Lake's National Trout Derby this upcoming Memorial Day weekend.

The brothers took Benjamin's boat out, they sailed around Painted Rock when the two saw something weird a mile out. Mike grabbed a pair of binoculars and saw a capsized kayak, he could see the man waving a paddle.

The two picked up speed, yelling to the man to stay calm and above the water.

"The guy was cold as ice," Mike said. "He was just going down."

When the boat got near the man, Mike tossed him a life preserver and the two pulled the man to the boat safely.WARNING: The following video may be disturing to some. Viewer discretion is advised

They raced to shore and called 911. The man was taken away, and Mike, who is also a five-time heart-attack survivor, went to the local hospital as well for observation.

The next day, the man who the two brothers saved stopped by Mike's hospital room to say thank you. "He was amazed that we were brothers," Mike said.

Mike told him, "well, we're your brothers now."
